response: "{ \"title\": \"Easy: Array Rotation\", \"description\": \"Given an array of integers and an integer k, write a function that rotates the array to the right by k steps.\\n\\n#### Function Signature\\n```python\\ndef rotate_array(arr: list[int], k: int) -> list[int]:\\n```\\n\\n#### Input\\n- `arr` (list[int]): An array of integers.\\n- `k` (int): The number of steps to rotate the array to the right.\\n\\n#### Output\\n- Returns the rotated array.\\n\", \"code\": \"def rotate_array(arr: list[int], k: int) -> list[int]:\\n    if not arr:\\n        return []\\n    k %= len(arr)\\n    return arr[-k:] + arr[:-k]\\n\", \"tests\": [\"assert rotate_array([1, 2, 3, 4, 5], 2) == [4, 5, 1, 2, 3]\", \"assert rotate_array([-1, -2, -3, -4, -5], 1) == [-4, -5, -1, -2, -3]\", \"assert rotate_array([], 0) == []\", \"assert rotate_array([1, 2, 3], 5) == [3, 1, 2]\"] }"
